item.description:
During our speed workout Tuesday evening, Jennifer and I were musing about putting together an informal transition clinic and mini-tri at Walden. Since Saturday looks like the only dry day throughout the next week, lets get together at Walden, practice setting up for T1 & T2, and then actually practice a mini-tri.

Meet at the Walden Pond bike rack at 9:00 AM. We'll spend 30 minutes to an hour yakking over how to setup for T1/T2, set it up, and then do a mini-tri:

  • swim 300 yards (short way across the Pond & back)
  • run/waddle/walk over to transition
  • T1
  • bike (route TBD but probably a short 7 mile out-and-back to Sandy Pond Rd)
  • T2
  • run 2 laps around Walden (~3 miles)


Here's stuff you may want to bring. YMMV:

  • swim cap
  • swim goggles
  • (optional) ear plugs
  • (optional) nose clips
  • (optional) wet suit & BodyGlide (if you want to practice stripping at T1)
  • towel
  • bike
  • bike helmet
  • bike top
  • bike bottom
  • bike shoes
  • (optional) bike socks
  • (optional) bike gloves
  • sunglasses
  • sun screen & lip balm
  • bike bottle or CamelBack
  • bike lock*
  • running shoes
  • running socks
  • (optional) running hat
  • (optional) fuel belt
  • (optional) gels, electrolyte tablets, & rehydration drinks**

I may have left out stuff. Email me and I'll edit.

* The bike lock is not necessary in a triathlon, but because there'll be no one to watch your wheels at this mini-tri during the swim and run portions, you should bring a lock to keep your bike secured.

** Gels, electrolyte tablets, & rehydration drinks are usually necessary in a triathlon, but because this mini-tri is so short, you probably won't get a chance to practice your nutrition. On the other hand, you may want to have some afterwards to speed your recovery.

CAVEAT, CAUTION, & DISCLAIMER

This is NOT a real triathlon, we're just practicing. We'll be swimming with others, biking in traffic, and running on a non-closed course. Use extreme caution at all times. Keep your wits about you.
item.how_to_find_us: Look for my red Viner bicycle - steel frame w/ carbon fork & aero bars
item.name: Walden Pond transition clinic & mini-tri
